main_text_content: Beyond pasta, spread this pesto on sandwiches, pair it with some hard-boiled or scrambled eggs, use it as a base for pizzas or flatbreads, or dollop it over rice.
main_html_content:
1. Recipes
  2. Dinner

Broccoli

Burnt Broccoli Pesto

by: Carolina Gelen

json_ld_objects.name: Burnt Broccoli Pesto
json_ld_objects.description: Beyond pasta, spread this pesto on sandwiches, pair it with some hard-boiled or scrambled eggs, use it as a base for pizzas or flatbreads, or dollop it over rice.

recipeInstructions.name: Drizzle the 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a cast-iron skillet over medium heat. When the oil is shimmering, add the broccoli florets to the pan and weigh them down using a grill press or another heavy skillet. Char the broccoli for 4 to 6 minutes, without moving it, until the broccoli is burnt and charred in spots.
recipeInstructions.text: Drizzle the 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a cast-iron skillet over medium heat. When the oil is shimmering, add the broccoli florets to the pan and weigh them down using a grill press or another heavy skillet. Char the broccoli for 4 to 6 minutes, without moving it, until the broccoli is burnt and charred in spots.

recipeInstructions.name: Use a wooden spoon to toss the broccoli, then pour in ½ cup of water. Cover the pan with a lid or sheet pan and steam the broccoli florets for 7 to 10 minutes, until most of the water has evaporated and the broccoli is bright green and fork-tender.
recipeInstructions.text: Use a wooden spoon to toss the broccoli, then pour in ½ cup of water. Cover the pan with a lid or sheet pan and steam the broccoli florets for 7 to 10 minutes, until most of the water has evaporated and the broccoli is bright green and fork-tender.

recipeInstructions.name: Using a mortar and pestle, blender, or food processor, process the nuts, garlic, pepper, and salt until smooth. Add the Parmesan, basil, and ⅓ cup of oil and blend until smooth. Add the charred broccoli and process until roughly blended (leave some chunkier bits in there for texture).
recipeInstructions.text: Using a mortar and pestle, blender, or food processor, process the nuts, garlic, pepper, and salt until smooth. Add the Parmesan, basil, and ⅓ cup of oil and blend until smooth. Add the charred broccoli and process until roughly blended (leave some chunkier bits in there for texture).

recipeIngredient: 1/3 cup plus 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, divided
1/4 cup raw nuts (small, such as pine nuts, or chopped, such as walnuts)
1 handful basil leaves (or another tender herb, like parsley or dill)

video.name: Burnt Broccoli Pesto
video.description: Beyond pasta, spread this pesto on sandwiches, pair it with some hard-boiled or scrambled eggs, use it as a base for pizzas or flatbreads, or dollop it over rice.
